title: Critical and miscellaneous essays.
author: Wilson, John
snippet: upon the banks of Kirtle," — or thou thyself, sweeter singer than them all, when willing — as I have seen thee — to charm with change thy father's ear, after the Bride's Maid's Chorus.

title: Two gray tourists: from papers of Mr. Philemon Perch
author: Johnston, Richard Malcolm
snippet: Of the ballads I recited, he said he liked best that of Kirhconnell lee, and wished, when we were rushing by Kirkcon- nell, that we had time to visit the churchyard where are the graves, side by side, of Fair Helen and her lover, who died on the banks of the Kirtle so long ago.
